Description: This heavily reinforced pillbox allows the garrisoned infantry with anti-tank rifles to fire on approaching enemy armour from a safe position.
Used to slow down enemy infantry movement. Can be dismantled with a Wrench.
An old coastal defence gun that has been reused for the defence of key locations against naval bombardment.
A portable device that mixes various materials to form Concrete, which are used to build heavily fortified structures.
An area where certain structures can be built and prepared for shipping.
Capable of firing different grenades, quickly and at long range, the Fissura gd.I is mobile enough for easy transport, while increasing the effectiveness of infantry ordinance.
A device used to intercept enemy radio broadcasts transmitted from nearby sources.
A defensive emplacement with a 68mm Anti-tank cannon. This rudimentary weapon was once built to fit onto the hull of large naval vessels, but was eventually phased out and repurposed.
This heavy artillery cannon is designed to cripple enemy fortifications from an entrenched position. Its long heavy barrel gives the "Thunderbolt" outstanding range.
A heavy cannon designed to shatter the garrisons and fortifications of advancing forces. The Exalt is best utilized when emplaced into a defensive position to take advantage of its impressive range.
A light artillery cannon designed to be a fixture in defensive fortifications. The Lariat sports a formidable long-range 120mm cannon designed to put immense pressure on enemy infantry.
The Snare Trap is a repurposed anti-aircraft flak cannon used to fortify emplaced positions with twin anti-infantry machine guns.
A research facility where players can contribute towards the research of their faction's Tech Tree.
A manufacturing plant for producing military equipment.
A makeshift bridge for transporting light equipment over a short distance. Will take damage when vehicles drive across.
A field medical facility used to treat critically wounded soldiers at the front line.
A pit of fire used to keep soldiers warm during Snow Storms. Requires Diesel to fuel.
An abandoned building in the world that has been fortified and garrisoned.
A large medical facility for treating critically wounded soldiers returning from the battlefield.

A high-tech listening post designed to intercept and decode enemy transmissions. The Intelligence Center can target distant locations and will continue to decipher sensitive transmissions over a sustained period.
An old Keep. Players can spawn and stockpile items here.
A heavy fixed position artillery piece that can release devastating firepower on distant enemy targets.
A well-fortified bunker position fitted with a mounted machinegun. Garrisoned infantry will lay down heavy suppressive fire upon approaching enemies from a fixed angle.
A magical box that duplicates the item in its first inventory slot.
Prevents the decay of nearby structures when supplied.
A manufacturing plant for large-scale production of military equipment.
A material pallet.
An Observation Tower that provides intel on friendly and enemy forces in an area.
A Refinery for converting raw resources into materials.
A mysterious box with a never ending supply of resources
A container that can carry large quantities of resources and can be transported by certain vehicles.
A reinforced dugout that gives the garrisoned rifle infantry a fortified defensive position to fire on approaching enemies from relative safety.
An abandoned launch site from the Great Wars for firing long range ballistic rockets.
A large building used to store crates, vehicles, boats, and shippable structures.
A container for shipping very large quantities of Crates using Crane loaded vehicles. This type of container can only be unloaded at Storage Depots and Seaports.
A small-scale boat production center.
A sign used to relay information to other soldiers.
A shared storage container that can be used to stash item.
A large building used to store crates, vehicles, and shippable structures.
A crate of packed structures.
An anti-tank obstacle that prevents vehicle access to an area. Can be dismantled with a Wrench.
A crate of packed vehicles.
A small-scale vehicle production center.
Reports nearby enemy movements to players with Radios equipped
A rack used to mount multiple firearms.
A small base used as a jump-off point for invading enemy regions. Players can spawn and stockpile items here.
A large forward operating base. Players can spawn and stockpile items here.
A large forward operating base. Players can spawn and stockpile items here.
A large forward operating base. Players can spawn and stockpile items here.
A temporary forward operating base. Players can spawn and stockpile items here.
An old fort. Players can spawn and stockpile items here.
A garrisoned focal building vital for the defence of a town. Players can spawn and stockpile items here.
A garrisoned focal building vital for the defence of a town. Players can spawn and stockpile items here.
A garrisoned focal building vital for the defence of a town. Players can spawn and stockpile items here.
A temporary forward operating base used to stage beach landings. Players can spawn and stockpile items here.
A simple hole dug into the ground to provide infantry with makeshift cover from enemy fire.

Built to compliment other free-standing artillery pieces, the emplaced Huber Starbreaker launches 94.5mm shells over very long distances. A necessary tool for infantry to knock back armoured Colonial advances.
Not to be outdone by its counterparts, the 2a-1 “Ruptura” is fitted with a 75mm cannon. Designed to aid in holding ground for longer durations, the “Ruptura” is a strong, efficient anti-armour tool.

To combat Caoivish ingenuity, the Meseans developed their own indirect RPG propulsion system. Dual launchers are fitted on a large emplacement platform to maximize coverage in an established position, rather than being relegated to a guerrilla warfare tool.

Built like a saw blade, the DAE 1b-2 emplacement gun is fitted with three cascading machine gun turrets. What the "Serra" lacks in power, it makes up for in sheer rate of fire for a weapon of its size.

The DAE 3b-2 fires rockets over long distances from a safe, emplaced position. This unique weapon was given its name due to the screams heard across the battlefield during its first deployment, with some referring to the barrage as a “web of death.”
A raised walkway for creating paths above complex Facilities.
A raised walkway for creating paths above complex Facilities.
Stairs that connect to raised Catwalks, which create paths above complex Facilities.
The Foreman is an all-purpose, no-frills, easy to assemble crane. Perfect for hauling heavy loads in facilities where loading and offloading is commonplace.
A factory for producing advanced ammo types such as large calibre shells, rockets, and flame ammo.
Extracts fuel from Crude Oil Fields. Must be constructed nearby.
A stationary harvester that automatically gathers Salvage. Requires Petrol.
A stationary harvester that automatically gathers Components. Requires Petrol.
A stationary harvester that automatically gathers Sulfur using Heavy Oil as fuel.
A stationary harvester that automatically gathers Coal. Requires Petrol.
Pumps water through pipes. Must be built on bodies of water.
A garage that facilitates vehicle modifications and upgrades.
Industrial piping that allows for automatic transport of various liquids and fuels into a network of pipes that connect to various facility structures.
Industrial piping that allows for automatic transport of various liquids and fuels. These specialized pipes can be built overhead to connect to pipe networks across areas with high traffic.
Industrial piping that allows for automatic transport of various liquids and fuels. These specialized pipes can be built underground to connect to pipe networks across areas with high traffic.
A weighted valve that controls the rate of flow through a pipeline. Requires a Wrench.
A structure that generates power by burning Diesel.
A power plant that generates a large amount of electricity using Oil or Coal.
A factory that refines raw resources into Construction Materials for advanced facilities. Additional modifications allow for the development of a variety of different materials.
A factory for refining raw resources into Processed Construction Materials. Additional modifications can allow for additional refined materials needed for advanced facility operations.
A processing plant that refines Coal into useful materials used in facility production and power.
A refinery that processes Oil into other useful materials for the purposes of production and power generation.
An open container marked for storing raw resources that can be transferred into and out of Facilities. Stockpiles may be public or reserved.
A space marked for storing refined materials that can be transferred into and out of Facilities. Stockpiles may be public or reserved.
Metal drums for storing various fuels that can be transferred into and out of Facilities. Stockpiles may be public or reserved.
A temporary road used to enable vehicle access between main roads and remote bases.
An industrial silo for storing various types of Fuel.

A standard Assembly Station for production of essential vehicles and equipment. Construction will take time and may be halted if resources are depleted. Some projects require a base vehicle to be present on the Assembly Station before production can begin.
A large Assembly Station for production of advanced vehicles and equipment, such as tanks and trains. Construction will take time and may be halted if resources are depleted.
A foundation that provides a suitable surface for constructing Facilities.
A foundation that provides a suitable surface for constructing Facilities.
A foundation that provides a suitable surface for constructing Facilities.
A foundation that provides a suitable surface for constructing Facilities.
A container for storing high volumes of liquids. Nearby structures and vehicles can refill directly from this container.
A power interface for manually disabling power in a circuit.
Conducts power between two Power Poles.
Used to connect Power Lines. Up to 4 Power Lines can be attached to a single pole.
Fills in this Crater, restoring the landscape around it.
Fills in this Crater, restoring the landscape around it.
Fills in this Bunker, restoring the landscape around it.
Fills in this Bunker, restoring the landscape around it.
Fills in this Bunker, restoring the landscape around it.
Fills in this Bunker, restoring the landscape around it.
Fills in this Foxhole, restoring the landscape around it.
Fills in this Trench, restoring the landscape around it.
Fills in this Trench, restoring the landscape around it.
Fills in this Trench, restoring the landscape around it.
Fills in this Trench, restoring the landscape around it.
Fills in this Trench, restoring the landscape around it.
Fills in this Trench, restoring the landscape around it.
An entrenched AT gun manned by stationed troops.
An entrenched AT gun manned by stationed troops.
A facility that stores equipment and ammunition for artillery. Retrieval is very quick for this structure.
A facility that stores equipment and ammunition for artillery. Retrieval is very quick for this structure.
An entrenched Howitzer manned by stationed troops.
An underground shelter that serves as a foundation for permanent fortifications. Connects to other Bunkers and Trenches.
An underground shelter that serves as a foundation for permanent fortifications. Connects to other Bunkers and Trenches.
An underground shelter that serves as a foundation for permanent fortifications. Connects to other Bunkers and Trenches.
A engineering facility that provides power to Bunker structures using pipe connections.
A engineering facility that provides power to Bunker structures using pipe connections.
An entrenched machine gun manned by stationed troops.
An entrenched machine gun manned by stationed troops.
An entrenched machine gun manned by stationed troops.
An entrenched machine gun manned by stationed troops.

A radio bunker that provides intel to friendly units about the surrounding area. Reinforced with wood, it can withstand more punishment than a standard radio tower, and therefore is capable of increased effectiveness.

A radio bunker that provides intel to friendly units about the surrounding area. Built from solid concrete, this reliable structure can push its effective range beyond lesser fortified radio structures.
A ramp that enables access to underground Bunkers.
A ramp that enables access to underground Bunkers.
A ramp that enables access to underground Bunkers.
An entrenched bunker manned by stationed troops armed with Rifles.
An entrenched bunker manned by stationed troops armed with Rifles.
An entrenched bunker manned by stationed troops armed with Rifles.
An underground shelter that serves as a foundation for permanent fortifications. Connects to other Bunkers and Trenches.
An underground shelter that serves as a foundation for permanent fortifications. Connects to other Bunkers and Trenches.
An underground shelter that serves as a foundation for permanent fortifications. Connects to other Bunkers and Trenches.
An old mine that automatically gathers Components using Fuel.
An old well that automatically gathers Crude Oil using Fuel.
An old mine that automatically gathers Salvage using Fuel.
An old mine that automatically gathers Sulfur using Fuel.
A segment of railway for heavy cranes. This type of railway can only be built on Foundations.
A segment of railway for train cars. Tracks can attach to or fork from existing railways to form complex networks.
A segment of railway for train cars. Tracks can attach to or fork from existing railways to form complex networks.
A segment of railway for train cars. Tracks can attach to or fork from existing railways to form complex networks. This type of railway can only be built on Foundations.
A segment of railway for train cars. Tracks can attach to or fork from existing railways to form complex networks.
A segment of railway for train cars. Tracks can attach to or fork from existing railways to form complex networks.
A segment of railway for train cars. Tracks can attach to or fork from existing railways to form complex networks. This type of railway can only be built on Foundations.
A segment of railway for small gauge train cars. Tracks can attach to or fork from existing railways to form complex networks.
A segment of railway for small gauge train cars. Tracks can attach to or fork from existing railways to form complex networks.
A segment of railway for small gauge train cars. Tracks can attach to or fork from existing railways to form complex networks. This type of railway can only be built on Foundations.
Used to prevent enemy infantry movement through an area. This structure is difficult to destroy with conventional weapons and must be dismantled with a Wrench.
A defensive wall that hinders enemy movement and provides cover during combat.
A defensive wall that hinders enemy movement and provides cover during combat.
A garrisoned strongpoint used in the defence of a town. Players can spawn and stockpile items here.
A garrisoned strongpoint used in the defence of a town. Players can spawn and stockpile items here.

A destroyed trench connector.
A destroyed trench connector.

A dugout that's used for cover and as passageways between Bunkers. Connects to other Trenches and Bunkers. This is a special Trench variant that can resize dynamically and can be built underneath roads.

A dugout that's used for cover and as passageways between Bunkers. Connects to other Trenches. This variant can also serve as an emplacement for mannable defenses.

An anti-tank obstacle that prevents vehicle access to an area, and is resistant to most types of damage.
A basic barrier that is used to prevent passage through an area.
A barrier that is used to prevent passage through an area.
A barrier that is used to prevent passage through an area.
All the power of a stationary Storm Cannon, but easily relocated via rails. This devastating cannon is capable of leveling enemy fortifications at very large distances.
A low profile flatbed car for transporting large resources and munitions over short distances on small gauge tracks.
